alert.note: Alert for Mississippi; New Madrid (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 19 at 1:13AM CST until January 20 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM CST THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing drizzle and fog will combine with a light dusting of snow in sub freezing temperatures to cause slippery patches on roads through the early morning commute. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...All of western Kentucky, Mississippi and New Madrid Counties in southeast Missouri, and Warrick and Spencer Counties in southwest Indiana. * WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory continues in effect through 9 AM CST this morning. Wind Chill Advisory in effect from 9 PM CST this evening to 9 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions through this morning`s commute. The cold wind chills tonight could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Untreated secondary roads and bridges as well as parking lots and sidewalks will be most susceptible to icing.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
